column1: 1;5372451192;"Mr. Terrarian";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id319397113";"4.25.2";5;"Garmin in General";"I recently purchased a Garmin Forerunner 235

column1: 2;6148572234;"Koopz23";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id261118439";"4.32";5;"Watches are great
column2: app is good";"I use the Garmin Fenix 6 and I could not recommend it more. I‚Äôve ran with it each day for 3 weeks and have also done kayaking and biking. I have only needed to recharge it twice

column1: As for the app

column1: 3;5084574606;"regretting i bought this";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id143461769";"4.24.1";2;"Used 2 garmin products and over them";"I have a vivoactive 3  for 1.5 yrs. column1: 4;4083847013;"Andy du Garmin";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id37155242";"4.18";2;"Rebuild Training Status Functionality ASAP!";"I‚Äôve been a Garmin fan since buying my Forerunner 935 on initial release two years ago. I take some ribbing from Suunto (climbing) and Apple Watch (running) friends
column2: but I‚Äôve been 100% pleased with the decision: the 935 is a great piece of tech
column3: and I‚Äôm sure the 945 is as well.

column1: HOWEVER: the Garmin Connect app seems to be getting more disappointing to use as a training tool with each revision. The prevailing style seems to prioritize oversimplified infographics over actually allowing users to review and interact with their data. As an example
column2: I‚Äôve been religiously using ‚Äútraining status‚Äù every day for two years to monitor the relationship between my 7-day training load and my target load (based on integrated firstbeat tables)
column3: making training adjustments on the fly... Now
column4: when I open the app
column5: all those brilliantly helpful
column6: adjustable
column7: overlaid charts are gone‚Äîthey have literally been replaced by a colored icon that says
column8: ‚ÄúProductive.‚Äù That icon changes in response to training each day
column9: but I can no longer view the data that underlies it on the fly
column10: rendering this potentially valuable source of insight meaningless within the app.

column1: Dev team: you‚Äôve had two years here. Please
column2: please
column3: please stop driving this app towards banal ‚Äúmass-market cuteness
column4: ‚Äù and instead
column5: try giving your devoted fanbase more powerful tools to articulate and shape our fitness goals. Would love to see you course correct here.";"2019-04-30T23:06:02-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=583446403&type=Purple%20Software";"583446403";232;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 10;5132617051;"Wheredidalldanicknamesgo";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id280948102";"4.25";4;"getting better again";"Latest update seems to have resolved all of the issues below. column1: 12;6535479813;"Ankush407";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id382178822";"4.36";4;"Very well designed for somewhat serious runners";"I have been using Garmin 645 for about 4 weeks and I really like it. I primarily use it for running

column1: 13;3810133995;"JWB457";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id545408877";"4.15.1";5;"Long time user";"Overall I really like Garmin app & Garmin products. Am currently on my 5th Garmin watch over 7 year period. I currently use a Garmin 235 and am anxiously awaiting its replacement. I find Garmin Connect has been a very reliable application and has all the data I need. I find it has all features I need and several more that I‚Äôve never gotten into. My only qualm with Garmin over the years is their heart rate measuring devices... to me it‚Äôs their weak spot. I have had issues with heart rate straps dating back to my first Forerunner 25 up through my Forerunner 620. I switch to wrist based on 235 and find it‚Äôs maybe 90-95% reliable - unfortunately that 5-10% comes at the most inopportune times! Like during the Boston marathon in 2017 or other critical races or workout. Actually it‚Äôs the Garmin Connect app that kept me with Garmin running watches. I know Polar does a better job tracking heart rate but I like the Garmin Connect app enough
column2: plus have years of data on it. Am hoping that improvements to the 235 replacement will include better more reliable heart rate tracking...";"2019-02-24T09:43:39-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=583446403&type=Purple%20Software";"583446403";195;"en";"POSITIVE"

column1: 14;3805016785;"D_Edwards16";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id286014896";"4.15.1";1;"Good but can be so much better";"May not deserve a 1 star but the fact there are so many problems/bugs that they haven‚Äôt addressed in years makes it a one to me. The first is the notifications. If I get one in anything it‚Äôll show as a very large number of notifications and won‚Äôt go away unless I tap on the top left icon. Second are the charts that are messed up when going in my run details. Might as well forget trying to look at pace chart. For some reason it wants to show pace as slow as 30 minutes a mile even if you never went that slow. For instance I may do a run and the slowest I go is 8 minutes a mile but since they pull the chart down to 30 minutes a mile you can really tell anything about your pace.

The other thing they need to do better on is making it more sociable. They have basically accepted strava as taking its business but if they would make a better screen with social interaction and better search engine for friends it would be great. They also need to make it to where people can use their phone as their GPS device in their app but I doubt they‚Äôll ever do that as they want people to buy their devices but the fact is most casual runners will never buy one cause they want their phone with them.";"2019-02-23T05:56:01-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=583446403&type=Purple%20Software";"583446403";238;"en";"POSITIVE"

21;5248999342;"macclthc";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id36812810";"4.25.1";2;"Just does not work consistently";"I am a Garmin Fan Boy. I have used their product both watches and bike computers for years. I like the Ecco system and I like the hardware functionality. However

This may finally be the straw that breaks the camels back and may return the Edge 830 and abandon Garmin devises for Wahoo. column1: 23;3832860238;"nino876";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id474998054";"4.15.1";5;"The best health tracking app - hands down!";"I must start off by saying I love this app

column1: 1. Allow users to customize sleep hours! My goal is 7 hours but Garmin doesn‚Äôt allow this setting to be modified! You only have 8 as an option I tend to never make this goal which throws off my daily card showing that I made all of my goals! My health and fitness team recommends 6-9 hours I‚Äôm not certain if this is a general health standard but Garmin should at least allow us to set it within this range!
2. The watch menus ‚Äúin the app‚Äù -can use a overhaul ‚ÄúActivities
column2: Apps and More‚Äù should be collapsed as a single section which includes ‚Äúdata fields‚Äù and ‚Äúwidgets‚Äù currently they fall under appearance! I get it Garmin is trying to make it simpler for non-technical users however
column3: I think with less menus and more grouping it would improve workflow! Btw
column4: it used to be this way they changed it some time a go!

column1: 3. The App Store needs to be more integrated! It seems that Garmin should let the app include apps from the AppStore without launching a browser within the app! I would suggest putting the App Store directly below the watch on the main menu
column2: allow the api to talk directly to the store and have it better embedded into the app!

column1: 86;6241881826;"WelshyinUsa";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id261606611";"4.33";1;"Latest version crashes on an iPhone SE.  Doesn't work in landscape mode on IPads.";"The app is generally ok but there are a few major issues:

1) the app is only made for an iPhone and as a result it will not work in landscape mode on an iPad.  It would be sensible to have the ipad support where graphs and data could be displayed more clearly.

2) the gui on the iPhone/iPad is really not intuitive.  You have to scroll around to figure out where the 'connect/upload' button is.  A user interface for a device like this should have a simple 'upload' as the first menu item as this is what most people do.  The graphs and stats should all be laid out logically.  Like a simple window that has 1. Health data
column2: 2. Sports data and the sub catabolise under there such as health->graphs
column3: health->averages. 3. Watch screens

column1: 3) the most important data should always be displayed on the first screen.  Ie calories burned
column2: steps taken
column3: avg HR
column4: max/min HR
column5: resting HR. Miles run
column6: etc
